clinical_study.brief_title: The Validation and Efficacy of Varix Trainer as a Training Device Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (a Multicenter Study)
clinical_study.official_title: The Validation and Efficacy of Varix Trainer as a Training Device Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (a Multicenter Study)

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this exploratory validation study is to compare levels of expertise (or non-expertise) between GI fellows and experts with the varix trainer. The main question it aim to answer is:
Can the varix trainer distinguish levels of expertise (or non-expertise) between novices and experts for specific skills (torque, small wheel and retroflexion techniques)? Does the training with the varix trainer improves these specific skills of GI fellows? Participants will do the pre-training test, practicing eight-sessions (each session is approximately 15minutes) and then do the post-training test.

primary_outcome.measure: Motor skill for endoscopic tip control improvement VS control
primary_outcome.description: Speed of pointing to 20 numbers using Varix trainer model I

secondary_outcome.measure: Motor skill for endoscopic tip control 1st year fellow trainee VS 2nd year fellow trainee VS expert
secondary_outcome.description: Speed of pointing to 20 numbers using Varix trainer model I

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will do the pre-training test, practicing eight-sessions (each session is approximately 15minutes) and then do the post-training test.
Participants in this group will do the pre-training test, and then do the post-training test after the pre-test 4-6weeks.

intervention.description: Eight sessions training in endoscopic tip control using Varix trainer model I.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- We enrolled participants from Ramathibodi hospital King Chulalongkorn Memorial hospital Siriraj hospital Rajavithi hospital Vajira hospital Nanthana-Kriangkrai Chotiwattanaphan Institute of Gastroenterology and Hepatology Srinagarind Hospital
1. Expert (> 1,500 EGD)
2. Trainees (First and second year fellow)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Deny to participate in our study
